DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Bone Marrow Specimen Collection Tube Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of a bone marrow tissue collection tube in a hollow cylinder to laboratory for examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Specimen Tube Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the tube collection of the bone marrow tissue for laboratory examination or diagnosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of a specimen collected tube in a hollow cylinder to a laboratory for examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act or business of transporting goods.: Any mechanism of mass communication.

Concepts.definition: The act or business of transporting goods.
Any mechanism of mass communication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: RED TOP

An alkali metal with atomic number 11, atomic weight 23, atomic symbol Na and is used in the manufacture of esters, and preparation of organic compounds, including medicinals.  The ion form is involved in many physiologic preocesses, including blood pressure regulation and electrolyte balance.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Na, atomic number 11, and atomic weight 23.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: RNA preservation (PAXgene or similar)

An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.13 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A shape whose base is a circle and whose sides taper up to a point.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: RPMI/EDTA
A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Streck Cell Free DNA tube

The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.
A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: A flexible container for semisolid drug products which is flattened and crimped or sealed at one end and has a reclosable opening at the other.

Concepts.definition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
A flexible container for semisolid drug products which is flattened and crimped or sealed at one end and has a reclosable opening at the other.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
